intro: Kaempferia scaposa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ginger or white ginger, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive, spicy aroma. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Kaempferia scaposa thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
